metadata.title: CVE-2017-13194 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
A vulnerability in the Android media framework (libvpx) related to oddframe width. Product: Android. Versions: 7.0, 7.1.1, 7.1.2, 8.0, 8.1.Android ID: A-64710201.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-13194` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvpx1 - 1.3.0-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
vpx-tools - 1.3.0-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libvpx package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.0-2ubuntu0.1~esm1').
